purpose.summary: This copybook defines a set of constants representing IMS function codes and a parameter count. These constants are used when making calls to IMS databases.
purpose.business_context: This copybook is used in programs that interact with an IMS database.

paragraphs.purpose: This data structure defines a set of constants representing IMS function codes used for database operations. Each function code is a 4-character alphanumeric field initialized with a specific value representing an IMS command. These commands include 'GU' (Get Unique), 'GHU' (Get Hold Unique), 'GN' (Get Next), 'GHN' (Get Hold Next), 'GNP' (Get Next within Parent), 'GHNP' (Get Hold Next within Parent), 'REPL' (Replace), 'ISRT' (Insert), and 'DLET' (Delete). These codes are used as parameters when calling IMS subroutines to specify the desired database operation. The values are directly assigned within the copybook and are intended to be used as read-only constants within the calling program. This paragraph does not perform any error handling or call any other programs.
paragraphs.dead_code_reason: Record layout 'FUNC-CODES' is never used by any program

paragraphs.purpose: This data item defines a COMP-5 signed integer constant representing the number of parameters expected by an IMS call. It is initialized with the value +4. This constant is likely used to ensure that the correct number of parameters are passed when invoking IMS functions. The value is directly assigned within the copybook and is intended to be used as a read-only constant within the calling program. It does not perform any error handling or call any other programs.

dead_code.name: FUNC-CODES
dead_code.reason: Record layout 'FUNC-CODES' is never used by any program
